title: Math-Viz: PDE Visualization Framework
text:
PDE Visualization Framework - A comprehensive tool for solving and visualizing Partial Differential Equations with real-time 3D rendering.

Quick Links

GitHub Repository
Live Web App



Current Features

Explicit Finite Difference Solver with stability control
Real-time 3D Visualization & analytical reference comparison
35+ Boundary Condition Functions
MP4 Export for animations
CLI + Web Interface

title: Math-Viz
text:
PDE Visualization Framework
A comprehensive tool for solving and visualizing Partial Differential Equations with real-time 3D rendering.
Try it out: Live Web App
GitHub Repository: View on GitHub

Overview
Math-Viz provides an intuitive interface for exploring complex mathematical concepts through interactive 3D visualization.

Supported PDEs
PDE Overview
├── Heat Equation (Parabolic / Time-Dependent)
│   ├── Finite Domain (Bounded)
│   └── Infinite Domain (Unbounded)
│       ├── Fourier Transform
│       └── Heat Kernel (Fundamental Solution)
│
├── Laplace Equation (Elliptic / Steady-State)
│   ├── Cartesian (Rectangle)
│   │   ├── Dirichlet (Prescribed Value)
│   │   └── Neumann (Prescribed Derivative)
│   └── Polar (Disk)
│       ├── Dirichlet
│       └── Neumann
│
├── Poisson Equation (Elliptic / Steady-State)
│   ├── Dirichlet
│   └── Neumann
│
└── Wave Equation (Hyperbolic / Time-Dependent)
    ├── Finite Domain (Standing Waves)
    │   ├── 1D String (Separation of Variables)
    │   └── 2D Membrane (Sep. of Vars in Polar/Rect)
    │
    └── Infinite Domain (Traveling Waves)
        ├── 1D (D'Alembert's Formula)
        ├── 2D (Method of Descent / Poisson)
        └── 3D (Kirchhoff's Formula)



Features

Real-time 3D rendering
PDE solving capabilities
Interactive parameter adjustment
Export functionality
